title: Corrections & Amplifications
text:
A Page One article on Saturday about Kyle Rittenhouse's acquittal in Kenosha, Wis., contained quotations and a photograph of a man who later said he had used a fake name, Brandon Lesco, when speaking to the Journal on Friday outside the courthouse. The man's quotations and his image have been removed from the online version of the article.

(See: "Rittenhouse Acquitted In Wisconsin Killings" -- WSJ Nov. 20, 2021)

---

Northridge is a neighborhood in the city of Los Angeles. A U.S. News article on Monday about gasoline prices incorrectly said Northridge is outside Los Angeles.

(See: "U.S. News: In One Remote California County, Gasoline Surpasses $6" -- WSJ Nov. 22, 2021)

---

Comcast Corp.'s NBCUniversal is considering removing much of its content from the Hulu streaming service. A headline with a Business & Finance article about NBCUniversal incorrectly said Disney may pull Hulu shows.

(See: "Comcast Weighs Pulling Its Hulu Content" -- WSJ Nov. 23, 2021)

---

Geisinger runs nine hospitals in Pennsylvania. A Business News article on Monday about Novartis AG incorrectly stated that it runs 13 hospitals.

(See: "Business News: Novartis Rethinks Strategy For New Cholesterol Drug --- Drugmaker looks to rollouts via hospital systems in hopes it can unlock a larger market" -- WSJ Nov. 22, 2021)

---

The last name of Paul Mathews, of mountain-resort planning firm Ecosign, was misspelled as Matthews in a Feb. 24, 2014, Sochi 2014 article about chairlifts at the Sochi Olympics.

(See: "Sochi 2014: The Dangling Future of Sochi's Ski Gondolas --- Massive Pre-Olympic Expansion Leaves Ski Resorts With More Lifts Than Tourists; 'All of This Will Be Useful'" -- WSJ Feb. 24, 2014)

---

Notice to readers

Some Wall Street Journal staff members are working remotely during the pandemic. Please send reader comments only by email or phone, using the contacts below, not via U.S. Mail.

---

Readers can alert The Wall Street Journal to any errors in news articles by e-mailing wsjcontact@wsj.com or by calling 888-410-2667.
